group_1.textLeft: Tum de dum de dum dum, ta ra la la de dahh~

group_1.textRight: That's a really invigorating song! I feel braver@listening to it!

group_1.textLeft: I know, right? I love this song, too!

group_1.textRight: Say, Charu, where are we going next?

group_1.textLeft: We're searching for some matsutake mushrooms!

group_1.textRight: Some...matsutake?

group_1.textLeft: The villagers that the shogun helped lived next to@the sea,
So he taught them different things about the@mountains, like the kinds of plants that grow there@and stuff.
And they ended up finding them!

group_1.textRight: They found matsutake?!

group_1.textLeft: No, I mean things like rare medicinal herbs.

group_1.textRight: Then why are we looking for matsutake?

group_1.textLeft: Matsutake was a common ingredient back in the@days of the shogun, but nowadays it's a delicacy!
Times like these call for matsutake instead of@medicinal herbs.

group_1.textRight: H-huh...times like these...?

group_1.textLeft: But where exactly do matsutake mushrooms grow?
On the ground...?@No, wait, don't they grow out of pine trees?!

group_1.textRight: Huh?
You're trying to find matsutake without knowing@where to find them?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I was, but...

group_1.textRight: Um, I...
I've heard that matsutake grows on the roots of@pine treesâ€”

group_1.textLeft: Ooh!@Then let's look for some!

group_1.textRight: But I don't think I've ever seen them growing in@these parts.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Whaaaat?!@So this was a no-go, then...
It's just like the river...@There's no gold here either.
Too bad...

group_1.textRight: ...Well, I don't know whether we can find matsutake@here,
But I do know of a place where we can gather lots@of wild vegetables.
I can lead you to it if you'd like.

group_1.textLeft: Sunao...!
Let's go, let's go!@Please!
Wow...!
We've barely been here for ten minutes and we've@already picked so much!

group_1.textRight: It's all thanks to you, Sunao!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah!
Sunao's knowledge of the mountains is just as good@as the shogun's!

group_1.textRight: I-I wouldn't...go that far...

group_1.textLeft: Okay!
Since there's no matsutake, I'm gonna pick a ton@of wild vegetables to make up for it...
Oh...s-sounds like I'm hungry, huh...

group_1.textRight: *Giggle*
We've been traveling around all morning.@Of course we're hungry!
We didn't have any matsutake, but did you figure@out any other attractions we have?

group_1.textLeft: Yes!
First, there's the fact that so many wild vegetables@grow around here.
And then there's Sunao, an expert in harvesting@them.
Her understanding of the mountains is as high as@Mt. Fuji and as deep as the Japan Trench!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Thank you very much.
In return for your praise...
I'll treat you to a homemade lunch with the@vegetables we've picked and the fish Shizuka caught.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:102601:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Yay!@Sunao's home cooking~!
